item.description:

at some point, however, you will hit puberty - its almost inevitable
[/quote]

Yea, but there are still people with self control. It is rare in our modern society, but it still exists… somewhat.[/quote]
We all have needs, you are expecting that a big group of people should denying their own needs. Go do something constructive instead of attacking civil rights.

PS: Stop masturbation, gain some self control.

item.title: Sexual question
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“m1lkman, post:132, topic:447969”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=550861.msg4057579#msg4057579 date=1343120987]
Most of those who say no, probably think it is a choice. So saying no is the wrong answer, because then those who had homosexual intercourse once can’t have straight sex anymore (because no straight person would have sex with them). Thus it’s no longer a choice.
[/quote]

People can live their lives without sex. I’ve been doing it for 16 years and I’m still going strong.[/quote]

Men become fertile at the age of ~12. Before that, you won’t have any sexual urges. So you’re either living without sex for only 4 years, or you need to visit a prostitute.

You can live your entire live without sex, but you’ll become frustrated. It’s part of being human, part of being animal even, to have sex. It’s healthy too, so I see no point in not doing it. You have to do it safe though, and think carefully before having kids. The fertile parts of our planet are pretty much filled to the brim with people.

Read full topic

Yea, but there are still people with self control. It is rare in our modern society, but it still exists… somewhat.

what? and end the human race?[/quote]

billions however is proving problematic with food running out unless scientists can create even better GMO crops that grow producing more on less land for less resources

item.title: Sexual question
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Whackatre:

R.I.P RSC: I am not gay and cannot speak for gays, but if the struggle you’re talking is of the conflict between choice and the general accepted norm of society, its completely their own decision. Peer pressure from middle school, anyone?

You’re talking about the choice to suppress your feelings or accept them as part of you. So ‘doing something’ with your homosexual feelings is a choice, yes. But being homosexual is not a choice.

Read full topic

item.title: Sexual question
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:118, topic:447969”]that doesnt nessecarily mean its a choice - the fact that its a product of their environment doesnt make it a choice.

that said, what you just said goes against scientific consensus, which is yes, they are ‘born into it’, in the sense they they are born predisposed to it i the same way that we are ‘born into’ gender roles etc.[/quote]

I feel that, yes, although a homosexual’s culture and its wide variety of influences play a large role, he or she still has a choice to pick a path. However, please explain how my statement goes against scientific consensus; I don’t understand.

Classic: Does a choice have to necessarily reflect the norm? Answering your question however: a gay.

R.I.P RSC: I am not gay and cannot speak for gays, but if the struggle you’re talking is of the conflict between choice and the general accepted norm of society, its completely their own decision. Peer pressure from middle school, anyone?

eczema3: For you and I it’s repulsive, but for many living in San Francisco (haha), it’s not.

Read full topic
